title: ColorsHSL and HSLA

metadata.description: Learn about ColorsHSL and HSLA with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
HSL Calculator rgb(255, 0, 0) #ff0000 H: S: L: HSL Colors HSL color values are supported in Edge, Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Opera 10+, and in IE9+. HSL stands for Hue, Saturation, and Lightness. HSL color values are specified with: hsl( hue, saturation , lightness ) Hue Hue is a degree on the color wheel from 0 to 360. 0 (or 360) is red, 120 is green, 240 is blue. Saturation Saturation can be described as the intensity of a color. It is a percentage value from 0% to 100%. 100% is full color, no shades of gray. 50% is 50% gray, but you can still see the color. 0% is completely gray; you can no longer see the color. Lightness The lightness of a color can be described as how much light you want to give the color, where 0% means no light (dark), 50% means 50% light (neither dark nor light), and 100% means full light. HSL color values are supported in all major browsers. Example HSLA Color Values HSLA color values are an extension of HSL color values, with an Alpha channel - which specifies the opacity for a color. An HSLA color value is specified with: hsla( hue, saturation , lightness, alpha ) The alpha parameter is a number between 0.0 (fully transparent) and 1.0 (not transparent at all): Example

hsla(0, 100%, 50%, 0.2)

hsla(0, 100%, 50%, 0.4)

hsla(0, 100%, 50%, 0.6)

hsla(0, 100%, 50%, 0.8)
